intro: Coenadenium brevilobum, commonly known as the narrow-lobed goldenroot, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features upright, branched stems covered in soft, hairy foliage. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in dense, spherical clusters, making it visually striking. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soil.
